easy.airplane: A powered heavier-than-air aircraft with fixed wings
easy.ant: Any of various insects in the family Formicidae in the order Hymenoptera, typically living in large colonies composed almost entirely of flightless females
easy.anvil: A heavy iron block used in the blacksmithing trade as a surface upon which metal can be struck and shaped
easy.apple: A common, round fruit produced by the tree Malus domestica, cultivated in temperate climates
easy.axe: A tool for felling trees or chopping wood etc consisting of a heavy head flattened to a blade on one side, and a handle attached to it
easy.backpack: A knapsack, sometimes mounted on a light frame, but always supported by straps, worn on a person's back for the purpose of carrying things
easy.banana: An elongated curved tropical fruit that grows in bunches and has a creamy flesh and a smooth skin
easy.bed: A piece of furniture, usually flat and soft, on which to rest or sleep
easy.bee: A flying insect, of the clade Anthophila within the hymenopteran superfamily Apoidea, known for its organised societies , for collecting pollen and  producing wax and honey
easy.belt: A band worn around the waist to hold clothing to one's body , hold weapons , or serve as a decorative piece of clothing
easy.bench: A long seat with or without a back, found for example in parks and schools
easy.bicycle: A vehicle that has two wheels, one behind the other, a steering handle, and a saddle seat or seats and is usually propelled by the action of a rider's feet upon pedals
easy.binoculars: A hand-held device consisting of a series of lenses and prisms, used to magnify objects so that they can be better seen from a distance, and looked at through both eyes
easy.bird: A member of the class of animals Aves in the phylum Chordata, characterized by being warm-blooded, having feathers and wings usually capable of flight, and laying eggs
easy.book: A collection of sheets of paper bound together to hinge at one edge, containing printed or written material, pictures, etc
easy.boomerang: A flat curved airfoil, that spins about an axis perpendicular to the direction of flight, that was originally used in various parts of the world as hunting weapons
easy.bowtie: A man's necktie tied in a bow around the throat
easy.bracelet: A band or chain worn around the wrist as jewelry/jewellery or an ornament
easy.brain: The control center of the central nervous system of an animal located in the skull which is responsible for perception, cognition, attention, memory, emotion, and action
easy.bread: A foodstuff made by baking dough made from cereals
easy.bridge: A construction or natural feature that spans a divide
easy.broom: A domestic utensil with fibers bound together at the end of a long handle, used for sweeping
easy.bucket: A container made of rigid material, often with a handle, used to carry liquids or small items
easy.bush: A woody plant distinguished from a tree by its multiple stems and lower height, being usually less than six metres tall; a horticultural rather than strictly botanical category
easy.butterfly: A flying insect of the order Lepidoptera, distinguished from moths by their diurnal activity and generally brighter colouring
easy.cactus: Any member of the family Cactaceae, a family of flowering New World succulent plants suited to a hot, semi-desert climate
easy.cake: A rich, sweet dessert food, typically made of flour, sugar and eggs and baked in an oven, and often covered in icing
easy.calculator: A mechanical or electronic device that performs mathematical calculations
easy.candle: A light source consisting of a wick embedded in a solid, flammable substance such as wax, tallow, or paraffin
easy.cannon: A complete assembly, consisting of an artillery tube and a breech mechanism, firing mechanism or base cap
easy.canoe: A small long and narrow boat, propelled by one or more people, using single-bladed paddles
easy.car: A wheeled vehicle that moves independently, with at least three wheels, powered mechanically, steered by a driver and mostly for personal transportation
easy.carrot: A vegetable with a nutritious, juicy, sweet root that is often orange in colour, Daucus carota, especially the subspecies sativus in the family Apiaceae
easy.castle: A large building that is fortified and contains many defences; in previous ages often inhabited by a nobleman or king
easy.cat: An animal of the family Felidae:
easy.chair: An item of furniture used to sit on or in, comprising a seat, legs, back, and sometimes arm rests, for use by one person Compare stool, couch, sofa, settee, loveseat and bench
easy.chandelier: A branched, often ornate, lighting fixture suspended from the ceiling
easy.circle: A two-dimensional geometric figure, a line, consisting of the set of all those points in a plane that are equally distant from a given point
easy.clock: An instrument used to measure or keep track of time; a non-portable timepiece
easy.crown: A royal, imperial or princely headdress; a diadem
easy.diamond: A glimmering glass-like mineral that is an allotrope of carbon in which each atom is surrounded by four others in the form of a tetrahedron
easy.donut: A deep-fried piece of dough or batter, commonly made in a toroidal or ellipsoidal shape, and mixed with various sweeteners and flavors, sometimes filled with jelly, custard or cream
easy.door: A portal of entry into a building, room, or vehicle, consisting of a rigid plane movable on a hinge
easy.drums: A percussive musical instrument spanned with a thin covering on at least one end for striking, forming an acoustic chamber, affecting what materials are used to make it; a membranophone
easy.duck: To quickly lower the head or body in order to prevent it from being struck by something
easy.dumbbell: A weight training implement consisting of a short bar with weight counterpoised on each end
easy.ear: The organ of hearing, consisting of the pinna, auditory canal, eardrum, malleus, incus, stapes and cochlea
easy.eye: An organ through which animals see
easy.face: The front part of the head of a human or other animal, featuring the eyes, nose and mouth, and the surrounding area
easy.fan: A hand-held device consisting of slats of material, gathered together at one end, that may be opened out into the shape of a sector of a circle and waved back and forth to cool oneself
easy.feather: A branching, hair-like structure that grows on the bodies of birds, used for flight, swimming, protection and display
easy.finger: A slender jointed extremity of the human hand, exclusive of the thumb
easy.fire hydrant: A device used by firefighters to obtain water from the main supply, consisting of a barrel, connections for hose and a valve assembly
easy.fireplace: An open hearth for holding a fire at the base of a chimney
easy.fish: A cold-blooded vertebrate animal that lives in water, moving with the help of fins and breathing with gills
easy.flower: A colorful, conspicuous structure associated with angiosperms, frequently scented and attracting various insects, and which may or may not be used for sexual reproduction
easy.foot: A biological structure found in many animals that is used for locomotion and that is frequently a separate organ at the terminal part of the leg
easy.fork: A pronged tool having a long straight handle, used for digging, lifting, throwing etc
easy.giraffe: A ruminant, of the genus Giraffa, of the African savannah with long legs and highly elongated neck, which make it the tallest living animal
easy.grapes: A small, round, smooth-skinned edible fruit, usually purple, red, or green, that grows in bunches on vines of genus Vitis
easy.grass: Any plant of the family Poaceae, characterized by leaves that arise from nodes in the stem and leaf bases that wrap around the stem, especially those grown as ground cover
easy.guitar: A stringed musical instrument, of European origin, usually with a fretted fingerboard and six strings, played with the fingers or a plectrum
easy.hamburger: A hot sandwich consisting of a patty of cooked ground beef or a meat substitute, in a sliced bun, sometimes also containing salad vegetables, condiments, or both
easy.hammer: A tool with a heavy head and a handle used for pounding
easy.hand: The part of the forelimb below the forearm or wrist in a human, and the corresponding part in many other animals
easy.harp: A musical instrument consisting of a body and a curved neck, strung with strings of varying length that are stroked or plucked with the fingers
easy.hat: A covering for the head, often in the approximate form of a cone or a cylinder closed at its top end, and sometimes having a brim and other decoration
easy.helicopter: An aircraft that is borne along by one or more sets of long rotating blades which allow it to hover, move in any direction including reverse, or land
easy.hexagon: A polygon with six sides and six angles
easy.hot dog: A sandwich consisting of a frankfurter, or wiener, in a bread roll, usually served with ketchup, mustard, relish, etc
easy.hourglass: A clock made of two glass vessels connected by a narrow passage through which sand flows
easy.house: A structure built or serving as an abode of human beings
easy.ice cream: A dessert made from frozen sweetened cream or a similar substance, usually flavoured
easy.key: An object designed to open and close a lock
easy.keyboard: A set of keys used to operate a typewriter, computer etc
easy.knife: A utensil or a tool designed for cutting, consisting of a flat piece of hard material, usually steel or other metal, usually sharpened on one edge, attached to a handle
easy.ladder: A frame, usually portable, of wood, metal, or rope, used for ascent and descent, consisting of two side pieces to which are fastened rungs
easy.lantern: A case of translucent or transparent material made to protect a flame, or light, used to illuminate its surroundings
easy.leaf: The usually green and flat organ that represents the most prominent feature of most vegetative plants
easy.light bulb: An evacuated glass bulb containing a metal filament which is heated by electrical resistance to produce light
easy.lightning: A flash of light produced by short-duration, high-voltage discharge of electricity within a cloud, between clouds, or between a cloud and the earth
easy.line: A path through two or more points a continuous mark, including as made by a pen; any path, curved or straight
easy.lollipop: An item of confectionery consisting of a piece of candy/sweet attached to a stick
easy.mailbox: A box into which mail is put
easy.microphone: A device  used to convert sound waves into a varying electric current; normally fed into an amplifier and either recorded or broadcast
easy.moon: The Earth's moon Luna; the sole natural satellite of the Earth
easy.nose: A protuberance on the face housing the nostrils, which are used to breathe or smell
easy.octagon: A polygon with eight sides and eight angles
easy.paintbrush: A thin brush for applying paint
easy.palm tree: A tree of the family Arecaceae usually characterised by having a single stem or trunk, directly from which sprout several leaves or fronds giving a shape like an outstretched hand
easy.paper clip: A small, folded, wire or plastic device used to hold sheets of paper together
easy.peanut: A legume resembling a nut, the fruit of the plant Arachis hypogaea
easy.pear: An edible fruit produced by the pear tree, similar to an apple but elongated towards the stem
easy.peas: A plant, Pisum sativum, member of the legume  family
easy.pig: Any of several intelligent mammalian species of the genus Sus, having cloven hooves, bristles and a nose adapted for digging; especially the domesticated animal Sus scrofa
easy.pillow: A soft cushion used to support the head in bed
easy.pineapple: A tropical plant, Ananas comosus, native to South America, having thirty or more long, spined and pointed leaves surrounding a thick stem
easy.pizza: A baked Italian dish of a thinly rolled bread dough crust typically topped before baking with tomato sauce, cheese and other ingredients such as meat, vegetables or fruit
easy.rabbit: A mammal of the family Leporidae, with long ears, long hind legs and a short, fluffy tail
easy.rainbow: A multicoloured arch in the sky, produced by prismatic refraction of light within droplets of rain in the air
easy.scissors: One blade on a pair of scissors
easy.scorpion: Any of various arachnids of the order Scorpiones, related to the spiders, characterised by two large front pincers and a curved tail with a venomous sting in the end
easy.screwdriver: A hand or machine tool which engages with the head of a screw and allows torque to be applied to turn the screw, thus driving it in or loosening it
easy.sheep: A woolly ruminant of the genus Ovis
easy.shoe: A protective covering for the foot, with a bottom part composed of thick leather or plastic sole and often a thicker heel
easy.shovel: A hand tool with a handle, used for moving portions of material such as earth, snow, and grain from one place to another
easy.skateboard: A narrow, wooden or plastic platform mounted on pairs of wheels, on which one stands and propels oneself by pushing along the ground with one foot
easy.skull: The main bones of the head considered as a unit; including the cranium, facial bones, and mandible
easy.smiley face: A simplified drawing of a smiling face, using two dots for the eyes and an arc for the mouth
easy.snail: Any of very many animals , of the class Gastropoda, having a coiled shell
easy.snake: A legless reptile of the sub-order Serpentes with a long, thin body and a fork-shaped tongue
easy.snowman: A humanoid figure made with large snowballs stacked on each other Human traits like a face and arms may be fashioned with sticks , a carrot , and stones or coal
easy.square: A polygon with four sides of equal length and four right angles; an equilateral rectangle; a regular quadrilateral
easy.stairs: A single step in a staircase
easy.star: Any small luminous dot appearing in the cloudless portion of the night sky, especially with a fixed location relative to other such dots
easy.strawberry: The sweet, usually red, edible fruit of certain plants of the genus Fragaria
easy.sun: A star, especially when seen as the centre of any single solar system
easy.swan: Any of various species of large, long-necked waterfowl, of genus Cygnus , most of which have white plumage
easy.sword: A long-bladed weapon with a hilt, and usually a pommel and cross-guard, which is designed to stab, slash, and/or hack
easy.syringe: A device used for injecting or drawing fluids through a membrane
easy.table: Furniture with a top surface to accommodate a variety of uses
easy.teapot: A vessel for brewing and serving tea
easy.teddy-bear: A plush toy in the shape of a bear
easy.telephone: A telecommunication device  used for two-way talking with another person
easy.television: An electronic communication medium that allows the transmission of real-time visual images, and often sound
easy.tent: A pavilion or portable lodge consisting of skins, canvas, or some strong cloth, stretched and sustained by poles, used for sheltering people from the weather
easy.toothbrush: A brush, used with toothpaste, for cleaning the teeth
easy.tornado: A violent windstorm characterized by a mobile, twisting, funnel-shaped cloud
easy.traffic light: A signalling device positioned at a road intersection or pedestrian crossing to indicate when it may be safe to drive, ride or walk, using a universal colour code
easy.tree: Fast growing function based on Kruskal's tree theorem
easy.triangle: A polygon with three sides and three angles
easy.umbrella: Cloth-covered frame used for protection against rain or sun
easy.vase: An upright open container used mainly for displaying fresh, dried, or artificial flowers
easy.wheel: A circular device capable of rotating on its axis, facilitating movement or transportation or performing labour in machines
easy.windmill: A machine which translates linear motion of wind to rotational motion by means of adjustable vanes called sails
easy.wine bottle: A tall bottle with a long neck, normally made of dark or clear glass, for holding and serving wine
easy.wine glass: A glass vessel, normally with a stem, from which wine is drunk

medium.alarm clock: A clock with an alarm that can be set to sound at a determined time
medium.ambulance: An emergency vehicle designed for transporting seriously ill or injured people to a hospital
medium.angel: An incorporeal and sometimes divine messenger from a deity, or other divine entity, often depicted in art as a youthful winged figure in flowing robes
medium.arm: The portion of the upper human appendage, from the shoulder to the wrist and sometimes including the hand
medium.bandage: A strip of gauze or similar material used to protect or support a wound or injury
medium.basket: A lightweight container, generally round, open at the top, and tapering toward the bottom
medium.bat: Any of the flying mammals of the order Chiroptera, usually small and nocturnal, insectivorous or frugivorous
medium.bathtub: A large container for holding water in which a person may bathe
medium.bear: A large omnivorous mammal, related to the dog and raccoon, having shaggy hair, a very small tail, and flat feet; a member of family Ursidae
medium.beard: Facial hair on the chin, cheeks, jaw and neck
medium.broccoli: A plant, Brassica oleracea var italica, of the cabbage family, Brassicaceae; especially, the tree-shaped flower and stalk that are eaten as a vegetable
medium.bulldozer: A tractor with an attached blade for pushing earth and building debris for coarse preliminary surface grading, demolishing building structures, etc
medium.bus: A motor vehicle for transporting large numbers of people along roads
medium.calendar: Any system by which time is divided into days, weeks, months, and years
medium.camel: A beast of burden, much used in desert areas, of the genus Camelus
medium.camera: A device for taking still or moving pictures or photographs
medium.campfire: A fire at a campground or on a camping trip, often used for cooking, to provide light and heat, to drive away bugs, and as a focal point for sitting around in the evening and talking
medium.church: A Christian house of worship; a building where Christian religious services take place
medium.coffee cup: A cup, typically a small one, in which coffee can be served
medium.compass: A magnetic or electronic device used to determine the cardinal directions
medium.computer: A person employed to perform computations; one who computes
medium.cookie: A small, flat, baked good which is either crisp or soft but firm
medium.cooler: Having a slightly low temperature; mildly or pleasantly cold
medium.couch: Couch grass, a species of persistent grass, Elymus repens, usually considered a weed
medium.cow: An adult female of the species Bos taurus, especially one that has calved
medium.crab: A crustacean of the infraorder Brachyura, having five pairs of legs, the foremost of which are in the form of claws, and a carapace
medium.crayon: A stick of colored chalk or wax used for drawing
medium.crocodile: Any of the predatory amphibious reptiles of the family Crocodylidae; a crocodilian, any species of the order Crocodilia, which also includes the alligators, caimans and gavials
medium.cup: A concave vessel for drinking from, usually made of opaque material  and with a handle
medium.dog: A mammal, Canis familiaris or Canis lupus familiaris, that has been domesticated for thousands of years, of highly variable appearance due to human breeding
medium.dolphin: A carnivorous aquatic mammal in one of several families of order Cetacea, famed for its intelligence and occasional willingness to approach humans
medium.dragon: A legendary serpentine or reptilian creature
medium.drill: A tool used to remove material so as to create a hole, typically by plunging a rotating cutting bit into a stationary workpiece
medium.elbow: The joint between the upper arm and the forearm
medium.elephant: A mammal of the order Proboscidea, having a trunk, and two large ivory tusks jutting from the upper jaw
medium.envelope: A paper or cardboard wrapper used to enclose small, flat items, especially letters, for mailing
medium.eyeglasses: An artificial lens, especially one of a pair
medium.fence: A thin artificial barrier that separates two pieces of land or a house perimeter
medium.firetruck: A vehicle equipped with fire fighting apparatus
medium.flying saucer: An unidentified flying object; UFO; usually with disc-like properties
medium.frog: A small tailless amphibian of the order Anura that typically hops
medium.headphones: A pair of speakers worn over or in the ears so only the wearer can hear the sound
medium.hedgehog: A small mammal, of the family Erinaceidae or subfamily Erinaceinae
medium.horse: Any of several animals related to Equus ferus caballus
medium.hot tub: A large tub, often situated outdoors, filled with hot water and used for communal leisure bathing
medium.hurricane: A severe tropical cyclone in the North Atlantic Ocean, Caribbean Sea, Gulf of Mexico, or in the eastern North Pacific off the west coast of Mexico, with winds of 119 km/h or greater
medium.jacket: A piece of clothing worn on the upper body outside a shirt or blouse, often waist length to thigh length
medium.kangaroo: A member of the Macropodidae family of large marsupials with strong hind legs for hopping, native to Australia
medium.knee: In humans, the joint or the region of the joint in the middle part of the leg between the thigh and the shank
medium.leg: A limb or appendage that an animal uses for support or locomotion
medium.lighter: Having light; bright; clear; not dark or obscure
medium.lighthouse: A tower or other structure exhibiting a light or lights to warn or guide sailors
medium.lion: A big cat, Panthera leo, native to Africa, India and formerly much of Europe
medium.lobster: A crustacean of the Nephropidae family, dark green or blue-black in colour turning bright red when cooked, with a hard shell and claws, which is used as a seafood
medium.map: A visual representation of an area, whether real or imaginary
medium.marker: An object used to mark a location
medium.matches: A competitive sporting event such as a boxing meet, a baseball game, or a cricket match
medium.megaphone: A portable, usually hand-held, funnel-shaped device that is used to amplify a person's natural voice toward a targeted direction
medium.mermaid: A mythological creature with a woman's head and upper body, and a tail of a fish
medium.monkey: Any member of the clade Simiiformes not also of the clade Hominoidea containing humans and apes, from which they are usually distinguished by smaller size and a tail
medium.mosquito: A small flying insect of the family Culicidae, the females of which bite humans and animals and suck blood, leaving an itching bump on the skin
medium.mountain: An elevation of land of considerable dimensions rising more or less abruptly, forming a conspicuous figure in the landscape, usually having a small extent of surface at its summit
medium.mouse: Any small rodent of the genus Mus
medium.moustache: A growth of facial hair between the nose and the upper lip
medium.mouth: The opening of a creature through which food is ingested
medium.mug: A large cup for hot liquids, usually having a handle and used without a saucer
medium.mushroom: Any of the fleshy fruiting bodies of fungi typically produced above ground on soil or on their food sources
medium.nail: The thin, horny plate at the ends of fingers and toes on humans and some other animals
medium.necklace: An article of jewelry that is worn around the neck, most often made of a string of precious metal, pearls, gems, beads or shells, and sometimes having a pendant attached
medium.octopus: Any of several marine molluscs of the family Octopodidae, having no internal or external protective shell or bone and eight arms each covered with suckers
medium.onion: A monocotyledonous plant , allied to garlic, used as vegetable and spice
medium.panda: The red panda , a small raccoon-like animal of northeast Asia with reddish fur and a long, ringed tail
medium.pants: An outer garment that covers the body from the waist downwards, covering each leg separately, usually as far as the ankles; trousers
medium.parachute: A device, generally constructed from fabric, that is designed to employ air resistance to control the fall of an object
medium.parrot: A kind of bird, many species of which are colourful and able to mimic human speech, of the order Psittaciformes or  of the family Psittacidae
medium.penguin: Any of several flightless sea birds, of order Sphenisciformes, found in the Southern Hemisphere, marked by their usual upright stance
medium.piano: A percussive keyboard musical instrument, usually ranging over seven octaves, with white and black colored keys, played by pressing these keys, causing hammers to strike strings
medium.pliers: A pincer-like gripping tool that multiplies the strength of the user's hand, often used for bending things
medium.pond: An inland body of standing water, either natural or man-made, that is smaller than a lake
medium.pool: A small and rather deep collection of  fresh water, as one supplied by a spring, or occurring in the course of a stream; a reservoir for water
medium.popsicle: Frozen fruit juice, flavored sugar water or the like, on a stick, of a size to be one serving
medium.postcard: A rectangular piece of thick paper or thin cardboard intended to be written on and mailed without an envelope
medium.potato: The tuber of a plant, Solanum tuberosum, eaten as a starchy vegetable, particularly in the Americas and Europe; this plant
medium.purse: A small bag for carrying money
medium.raccoon: A nocturnal omnivore native to North America, typically with a mixture of gray, brown, and black fur, a mask-like marking around the eyes and a striped tail; Procyon lotor
medium.radio: The technology that allows for the transmission of sound or other signals by modulation of electromagnetic waves
medium.rain: Condensed water falling from a cloud
medium.rake: A garden tool with a row of pointed teeth fixed to a long handle, used for collecting debris, grass, etc
medium.remote control: A device used to operate an appliance , vehicle or mechanical toy from a short distance away
medium.rhinoceros: Any of several large herbivorous pachyderms native to Africa and Asia of the five extant species in the family Rhinocerotidae, with thick, gray skin and horns
medium.rifle: A shouldered firearm with a long, rifled barrel to improve range and accuracy
medium.river: A large and often winding stream which drains a land mass, carrying water down from higher areas to a lower point
medium.roller coaster: An amusement ride consisting of a buggy on a track that rises, falls, twists and turns
medium.rollerskates: A boot having small wheels or casters attached to its sole; used for roller skating
medium.sandwich: A dish or foodstuff where two or more slices of bread serve as the wrapper or container of some other food
medium.saw: A tool with a toothed blade used for cutting hard substances, in particular wood or metal
medium.saxophone: A single-reed instrument musical instrument of the woodwind family, usually made of brass and with a distinctive loop bringing the bell upwards
medium.sink: A basin used for holding water for washing
medium.snowflake: A crystal of snow, having approximate hexagonal symmetry
medium.sock: A knitted or woven covering for the foot
medium.spider: Any of various eight-legged, predatory arthropods, of the order Araneae, most of which spin webs to catch prey
medium.spoon: An implement for eating or serving; a scooped utensil whose long handle is straight, in contrast to a ladle
medium.tiger: Panthera tigris, a large predatory mammal of the cat family, indigenous to Asia
medium.toe: Each of the five digits on the end of the foot
medium.toilet: A covering of linen, silk, or tapestry, spread over a dressing table in a chamber or dressing room
medium.tooth: A hard, calcareous structure present in the mouth of many vertebrate animals, generally used for eating
medium.toothpaste: A paste, normally used with a toothbrush, for cleaning the teeth
medium.tractor: A vehicle used in farms eg for pulling farm equipment and preparing the fields
medium.trombone: A musical instrument in the brass family, having a cylindrical bore, and usually a sliding tube
medium.truck: A small wheel or roller, specifically the wheel of a gun carriage
medium.trumpet: A musical instrument of the brass family, generally tuned to the key of B-flat; by extension, any type of lip-vibrated aerophone, most often valveless and not chromatic
medium.t-shirt: A lightweight shirt without buttons, usually with short sleeves and no collar Often made of cotton and frequently bears a picture or slogan
medium.underwear: Clothes worn next to the skin, underneath outer clothing
medium.violin: A musical four-string instrument, generally played with a bow or by plucking the string, with the pitch set by pressing the strings at the appropriate place with the fingers
medium.watermelon: A plant of the species Citrullus lanatus, bearing a melon-like fruit
medium.whale: Any of several species of large sea mammals of the infraorder Cetacea
medium.zebra: Any of three species of genus Equus: E grevyi, E quagga, or E zebra, all with black and white stripes and native to Africa
medium.zigzag: A line or path that proceeds by sharp turns in alternating directions

hard.aircraft carrier: A warship designed to carry aircraft, serving as a seagoing air base, with a deck on which aircraft can be launched and landed
hard.asparagus: Any of various perennial plants of the genus Asparagus having leaflike stems, scalelike leaves, and small flowers
hard.barn: A building, often found on a farm, used for storage or keeping animals such as cattle
hard.baseball: A sport common in North America, the Caribbean, and Japan, in which the object is to strike a ball so that one of a nine-person team can run counter-clockwise among four bases
hard.basketball: A sport in which two opposing teams of five players strive to put a ball through a hoop
hard.beach: The shore of a body of water, especially when sandy or pebbly
hard.blackberry: A fruit-bearing shrub of the species Rubus fruticosus and some hybrids
hard.blueberry: An edible round berry, belonging to the cowberry group , with flared crowns at the end, that turns blue on ripening
hard.cello: A large stringed instrument of the violin family with four strings, tuned from lowest to highest C-G-D-A, and played with a bow
hard.cell phone: A portable, wireless telephone, which changes antenna connections seamlessly during travel from one radio reception cell to another without losing the party-to-party call connection
hard.clarinet: A woodwind musical instrument that has a distinctive liquid tone whose characteristics vary among its three registers: chalumeau , clarion , and altissimo
hard.cruise ship: A passenger ship used for pleasure voyages, where the voyage itself and the ship's amenities are considered an essential part of the experience
hard.diving board: A springboard used for diving into water
hard.dresser: An item of kitchen furniture, like a cabinet with shelves, for storing crockery or utensils
hard.flamingo: A wading bird of the family Phoenicopteridae
hard.floor lamp: A lamp supported by a tall vertical pole in order that light comes from above those seated in the vicinity
hard.frying pan: A long-handled, shallow pan used for frying food
hard.garden: An outdoor area containing one or more types of plants, usually plants grown for food or ornamental purposes
hard.goatee: A beard trimmed to grow only at the center of the chin
hard.golf club: In golf, the implement used to hit the golf ball
hard.helmet: A protective head covering, usually part of armour
hard.hockey stick: A stick used to handle the puck in ice hockey, having a flat, angled blade at the end
hard.hospital: A large medical facility, usually in a building with multiple floors, where seriously ill or injured patients are given extensive medical and/or surgical treatment
hard.house plant: A plant that is grown indoors in places such as a house or office for decorative purposes
hard.jail: A place or institution for the confinement of persons held in lawful custody or detention, especially for minor offenses or with reference to some future judicial proceeding
hard.microwave: An electromagnetic wave with wavelength between that of infrared light and radio waves
hard.ocean: One of the large bodies of water separating the continents
hard.oven: A chamber used for baking or heating
hard.owl: Any of various birds of prey of the order Strigiformes that are primarily nocturnal and have forward-looking, binocular vision, limited eye movement, and good hearing
hard.passport: An official document normally used for international journeys, which proves the identity and nationality of the person for whom it was issued
hard.pickup truck: A light truck with an open cargo bed
hard.sailboat: A boat propelled by a sail
hard.shark: A scaleless, predatory fish of the superorder Selachimorpha, with a cartilaginous skeleton and 5 to 7 gill slits on each side of its head
hard.skyscraper: A very tall building with a large number of floors
hard.sleeping bag: A padded or insulated bag large enough to surround the whole body and which keeps the user warm while sleeping, used as a substitute for bedclothes
hard.snorkel: A hollow tube, held in the mouth, or mounted on and opening into a diving mask, used by swimmers for breathing underwater
hard.spreadsheet: A sheet of paper, marked with a grid, in which financial data is recorded and totals calculated manually
hard.squiggle: A short twisting or wiggling line or mark
hard.squirrel: Any of the rodents of the family Sciuridae distinguished by their large bushy tail
hard.steak: Beefsteak, a slice of beef, broiled or cut for broiling
hard.stereo: A system of recording or reproducing sound that uses two channels, each playing a portion of the original sound
hard.stethoscope: A medical instrument used for listening to sounds produced within the body, often combined with a sphygmomanometer
hard.stitches: A single pass of a needle in sewing; the loop or turn of the thread thus made
hard.stove: A heater, a closed apparatus to burn fuel for the warming of a room
hard.streetlight: Any large outdoor light used to illuminate a public area, usually urban
hard.string bean: A long, slender variety of green bean
hard.submarine: A boat that can go underwater
hard.suitcase: A large  piece of luggage used for carrying clothes, and sometimes suits, when travelling
hard.sweater: A knitted jacket or jersey, usually of thick wool, worn by athletes before or after exercise
hard.van: A covered vehicle used for carrying goods or people, usually roughly cuboid in shape, longer and higher than a car but smaller than a truck/lorry
hard.washing machine: A machine, usually automatic, which washes clothes, etc
hard.waterslide: A recreational slide with water flowing down it to reduce friction, sometimes involving the participant sitting on a mat or raft and sometimes leading into a pool at the bottom
hard.wristwatch: A watch that is worn on a strap or band fastened around the wrist
hard.yoga: Any of several Hindu or Buddhist disciplines aimed at training the consciousness for a state of perfect spiritual insight and tranquillity
